Which model should I prefer for time series forecasting?

I have time series as 0.4385487 0.7024281 0.9381081 0.8235792 0.7779642 1.1670665 1.1958634 1.1958634 0.8235792 0.8530141 0.8802216 1.1958634 1.1235897 1.3542734 1.3245534 0.9381081 1.1670665 1.1958634 0.8802216 1.3542734 1.1670665 4.9167998 0.9651803 0.8221709 1.1070461 1.2006974 1.3542734 0.9651803 0.9381081 0.9651803 0.8854192 1.3245534 1.1235897 1.2006974 1.1958634 0.4385487 1.3245534 4.9167998 1.2277843 0.8530141 1.0018480 0.3588158 0.8530141 0.8867365 1.3542734 1.1958634 1.1958634 0.9651803 0.8802216 0.8235792 4.9167998 1.1958634 0.9651803 0.8854192 0.8854192 1.2006974 0.8867365 0.9381081 0.8235792 0.9651803 0.4385487 0.9936722 0.8821301 1.3542734 1.1235897 1.6132899 1.3245534 1.3542734 0.8132233 0.8530141 1.1958634 1.2279813 0.8354292 1.3578511 1.1070461 0.8530141 0.9670581 1.1958634 0.7779642 1.2006974 1.1958634 0.8235792 1.3245534 0.5119648 2.3386331 0.8890464 0.8867365 4.9167998 1.2006974 1.2006974 0.6715839 4.9167998 0.7747481 4.9167998 0.8867365 1.2277843 0.8890464 1.2277843 0.8890464 1.0541099 0.8821301 I am using package "itsmr"-autofit(),"forecast"-auto.arima(),"package"--functions Autoregressive model > ar(t) Call: ar(x = t) Order selected 0 sigma^2 estimated as 0.9222 ARMA model > autofit(t) $phi [1] 0 $theta [1] 0 $sigma2 [1] 0.9130698 $aicc [1] 279.4807 $se.phi [1] 0 $se.theta [1] 0 ARIMA model > auto.arima(t) Series: t ARIMA(0,0,0) with non-zero mean Coefficients: intercept 1.2623 s.e. 0.0951 sigma^2 estimated as 0.9131: log likelihood=-138.72 AIC=281.44 AICc=281.56 BIC=286.67 The auto.arima function automatically differences time series: we don't have to worry about transformation. > auto.arima(AirPassengers) Series: AirPassengers ARIMA(0,1,1)(0,1,0)[12] Coefficients: ma1 -0.3184 s.e. 0.0877 sigma^2 estimated as 137.3: log likelihood=-508.32 AIC=1020.64 AICc=1020.73 BIC=1026.39` Which model should I select to get p,q values & for forecasting purpose?
